Hi. Does anyone know if John Harper&#39;s World of Dungeons is under the same license as Dungeon World? I imagine the 1979 copyright is not serious. :)
<div id='comment z12aur4ommuzxhyb304ch52rglmzgjkhlyk0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/116013665970125878211_photo.jpg'> Yochai Gal</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-25 02:11:16 (edited: 2018-08-25 02:11:16)</cite></p>
        <p>This has been asked before, and I believe that yes, it is free to modify as you wish.<br /><br />PS, I think your art for the DW Guide is amazing, and I want to see more!</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aur4ommuzxhyb304ch52rglmzgjkhlyk0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/102432256969084682723_photo.jpg'> Bruno Prosaiko</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-25 02:26:09 (edited: 2018-08-25 02:26:09)</cite></p>
        <p>Thanks, <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/116013665970125878211" oid="116013665970125878211">Yochai Gal</a></span>!<br /><br />My question is whether I could launch some commercial game with the rules of World of Dungeons (so elegant in their simplicity) or if I can only modify for non-commercial purposes.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z12aur4ommuzxhyb304ch52rglmzgjkhlyk0k'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103667855585775066713_photo.jpg'> Aaron Griffin</h4>
      <p><cite>2018-08-25 02:28:53 (edited: 2018-08-25 02:28:53)</cite></p>
        <p>Rules themselves are not copyrightable. Rules <b>text</b> is.</p>
</div>
